LanguageData.Mech_Centipede.label: Centipede
LanguageData.Mech_Centipede.description: Heavy combat mechanoids that glide on dozens of tiny legs. Their thick carpace and firepower makes them very effective against bunched-up static defenders. They are somewhat vulnerable to mobile hit-and-run tactics.
LanguageData.Mech_Centipede.tools.0.label: head
LanguageData.Mech_Centipede_Corpse.label: Centipede corpse
LanguageData.Mech_Scyther.label: Scyther
LanguageData.Mech_Scyther.description: Scythers are fast, spindly, armored human-sized combat Mechanoids. They usually carry one primary ranged weapon, and their bodies are adorned with two articulated blades to make them deadly in melee combat. They don't use cover. They are best handled by concentrated, overwhelming force.

LanguageData.Mech_Lancer.label: Lancer
LanguageData.Mech_Lancer.description: Lancer are agile, lanky, human-sized combat Mechanoids. LanguageData.Mech_Pikeman.label: Pikeman
LanguageData.Mech_Pikeman.description: A clunky multi-legged combat mechanoid specialized as a long-range weapons platform. While effective at distance, it is weak in close-range fights and in melee combat.\n\nVeterans of mechanoid wars know that often, the safest place to be around a pikeman is touching it.

LanguageData.Mech_Crawler.label: Crawler
LanguageData.Mech_Crawler.description: Crawlers are small spider-like Mechanoids. While not particularly sturdy, their speed, size and numbers more than make up for it. A tiny plasma cutter at their front allows them to cut through metal like butter. Their favorite passtime is open surgery.
